data.data1: Earned the status of State in the year 2000, Uttarakhand, which was earlier a part of Uttar Pradesh, is famous for its scenic beauty and pilgrim centers. If you are associated with religious beliefs, you may be keen to visit the place for its divinity and if you are a nature lover, you will find divinity in the rich expanse of endless natural beauty here. Wherever your faith is placed, be it in god or in the powers of nature to inspire you into living a life of fulfillment, Uttarakhand is the perfect destination.
data.data2: One of the things Uttarakhand is famous for is bamboo handicrafts made by Ringaal people in the Kumaon region. These beautiful bamboo art pieces are 100% eco-friendly and last long. You will find bags, purses, lampshades, furniture, and what not, all spun out of bamboo.

place.name: DEHRADUN
place.about: Nashik is an ancient city and the largest city in the northern region of the Indian state of Maharashtra. Situated on the banks of river Godavari, Nashik is the fourth largest city in Maharashtra, after Mumbai, Pune and Nagpur. Nashik is well known for being one of the Hindu pilgrimage sites of the Kumbh Mela, which is held every 12 years.[7][8] Nashik is located about 190 km north of state capital Mumbai.
